abstract.text: Enables customization of the initial glyph generation process.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The layout manager doing the layout.
A pointer to the layout manager’s glyph cache.
A pointer to a buffer containing glyph properties for the glyphs in the cache.
A pointer to the starting index for the characters in the text storage for which glyphs are generated.
A font to override the font attributes in the text storage for the specified character range.
The range of glyphs in the glyph cache to set.
The actual glyph range stored in this method. By returning
, it can indicate for the layout manager to do the default processing.
This message is sent whenever the layout manager is about to store the initial glyph information via
. To customize the initial glyph generation process, this method can invoke
with modified glyph information.
Querying glyph information surrounding
could lead to recursion since the data might not be available yet.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
The representation of a font in an app.
An object that coordinates the layout and display of text characters.
Constants that describe actions for control characters.
Stores the initial glyphs and glyph properties for a character range.
A set of optional methods that delegates of layout manager objects implement.
Enables customization of the initial glyph generation process.
Returns the control character action for the control character at the specified character index.
Informs the delegate when the specified layout manager invalidates layout information (not glyph information).
A Swift-only concrete structure that backs the range type alias.
An index into the internal glyph table of a font.
A pointer for accessing data of a specific type.

, it can indicate for the layout manager to do the default processing.
